questions.title: Is Cloud Financial Management managed in a programmatic way?
questions.description: By managing FinOps or CFM as a program, you ensure there are active best practices carried out in a reactive and proactive way. FinOps is a daily operational program that is managed and improved. A program involves planning, roadmap development, prioritization, milestones, etc.

choices.title: There is a defined FinOps program active in the organization.

helpfulResource.displayText: Different than a FinOps project, a program is a continuous set of activities surrounding cloud financial management in your organization.

improvementPlan.displayText: If there is no defined FinOps program active in the organization, there are a few things you should do. If there are ongoing FinOps initiatives, see how you can bundle those into one and form a program out of it. If FinOps is a green field to you, the action points from this tool will form the basis to get started.

choices.title: The FinOps program includes proactive cloud financial management measures.

helpfulResource.displayText: Part of doing a daily operational finops program is being proactive in your cost control. If your FinOps program is only reactive, you will always act to reduce waste only.

improvementPlan.displayText: Proactive actions are fueled by historical data, roadmaps, forecasts, and business cases. Proactive measures are mainly categorized in rate optimization and governance policies (tagging strategy and enforcement, awareness creation, knowledge sharing, design, and built management). See which of these your organization needs and how you can implement them.

choices.title: The FinOps program includes proactive and reactive cloud financial management measures.

helpfulResource.displayText: Reactive measures are usually how FinOps projects start in an organization. They arise from the need to respond to an increasing cost. Proactivity then helps that reactive project to grow into a program.

improvementPlan.displayText: Reactive actions are fueled by monitoring, alerting and automation. Make sure you have proper monitoring and alerting in place to support reactive action and that there is a clear Service Agreement in place on how the reactive actions should be taken. Reactive actions should include rightsizing, clean-up, anomaly response and others.

choices.title: Project or Program management resources are available to the FinOps team.

helpfulResource.displayText: For any project or program to succeed in an organization, it needs proper management. PMs can help the FinOps team develop and deliver planning, roadmaps, policies, targets, assignments, operational planning etc.

improvementPlan.displayText: Identify a project manager, program manager, project coordinator or team lead to help with the management of the FinOps efforts. The engineers and analysts assigned to FinOps capabilities should be able to focus on the implementation of cloud financial management best practices and not on the overhead management.

choices.title: The FinOps program has its own set of targets and KPIs to assess and improve its performance.

helpfulResource.displayText: Just like any initiative, a FinOps program needs targets and KPIs to help it maintain course and have measurable results.

improvementPlan.displayText: A FinOps Program needs goals, targets and KPIs to measure and evaluate its impact. Start by implementing some KPIs around reporting, monitoring, alerting, reserved capacity utilization, etc.

choices.title: None of the above apply to us.

helpfulResource.displayText: If you don't yet have a FinOps program in place, select this option.

improvementPlan.displayText: While it is not easy to start and complete a successful FinOps project, a FinOps program can be even more challenging. Work on implementing the other action points of this topic.

riskRules.condition: choice1 && choice2 && choice3 && choice4 && choice4 && choice5

questions.title: Are there governance policies and measures in place to support FinOps?
questions.description: FinOps can be a very process-filled practice, but in the background it depends heavily on governance policies and automation. Services such as AWS Config, AWS Control Tower and third-party tools are necessary to enforce the standards FinOps needs to be effective.

choices.title: Governance policy compliance checks happen in an automated and systematic way.

helpfulResource.displayText: Policies should be written up based on the desired outcome, but enforcing them by discipline only gets you so far. The more complex your organization becomes, the bigger the need for automated governance policy compliance measures.

improvementPlan.displayText: See if there are tools already in place that help you monitor compliance with policies. Work with your Quality, Operational Control, or Compliance department on this. Third-party tools can help you set up best practice checks and automate monitoring of them. In AWS some tools are also available natively.

choices.title: Governance policies and measures are continuously reviewed and kept up to date with relevant changes.

helpfulResource.displayText: For the most part, this pertains to changes and lessons learned coming out of governance measures themselves. Governance policies and (automated) measures to enforce them will only become obsolete if left with management.

improvementPlan.displayText: Plan in a review of the guard rails and service control policies, third-party controls and others you have in place on a quarterly or half-yearly basis. This should be part of the workload for a dedicated FinOps engineer, but alternatively it can be taken up by a governance or compliance team if they have sufficient affinity with AWS.

choices.title: Non-compliant resources or situations are escalated to the necessary stakeholders in a standardized way.

helpfulResource.displayText: Often we see organizations finding untagged or poorly tagged resources, and bring this to the attention of the resource owner via an e-mail or a conversation in the office. While this is great, having a ticket or standard procedure often ensures the non-compliant resources are not forgotten about and action can be followed up.

improvementPlan.displayText: Discuss internally what reasonable actions should be taken for possible non-compliant resources. How long after alerting a stakeholder of a faulty tag, can you wait until repercussions? If an EBS volume or EC2 instance has an outdated type (t2 vs t3 or gp2 vs gp3), how long until actions will be taken? Standardize the action plan and make this available.

choices.title: Actions against non-compliant resources receive sufficient leadership sponsoring.

helpfulResource.displayText: The biggest cause for non-compliance is often the need to go fast. While this might save time in the short term, it will cost more time and effort when things need to be brought back in line. Leadership sponsoring non-compliance alerts and subsequent actions is crucial to make sure actions get taken.

improvementPlan.displayText: Identify a chain of command for non-compliance tickets and make sure you know who to involve when a non-compliant resource is made. Should this be a team lead or management-level compliance stakeholder, a technology manager, or someone else?

choices.title: The importance of governance and policy compliance is championed by upper management.

helpfulResource.displayText: Leading by example and explaining the why are very important here. Adhering to policy and governance strategy requires discipline. Discipline is in return supported by clear leadership and prioritization.

improvementPlan.displayText: Only by making sure that there is an organization-wide strategy for FinOps governance and that this is stressed as an important point, can it succeed. In the end, it is about standardization and data quality. Identify the appropriate champions or stakeholders on the upper management level and set up a recurring review with them. This can be quarterly for example.

choices.title: None of the above apply to us.

helpfulResource.displayText: If you don't yet have a set of (automated) policies and measures in place about Cloud Financial Management, select this option.

improvementPlan.displayText: While you may have policies or part of your cloud strategy formalized that interact with cloud financial management principles, it is crucial to manage, automate and monitor their effectiveness. Work on implementing the other action points of this topic.

riskRules.condition: choice1 && choice2 && choice3 && choice4 && choice4 && choice5

questions.title: Is FinOps promoted as a culture in the organization with transparent results?
questions.description: A final part of good Cloud Financial Operations is to show the organization which results are achieved. Showing the savings gained, optimizations achieved, capital freed, new dashboarding developed, etc. Showing positive results, but also being transparent about challenges faced helps build a larger culture of cloud financial management in the organization.

choices.title: Expected FinOps business value is expressed in targets and set against the cost of the FinOps efforts.

helpfulResource.displayText: As FinOps is all about bringing balance to the cost paid over the business value gained, this applies also to the larger FinOps program. In order to measure its effectiveness, the value gained needs to be offset against the cost.

improvementPlan.displayText: Start by identifying the cost of the FinOps program and offset it against the potential value. If you have it available, work with existing savings data and resource efficiency metrics. By comparing those, you will be able to work out the return on investment on your FinOps efforts.

choices.title: The finance and procurement departments are supported in understanding and working with AWS.

helpfulResource.displayText: The cloud requires everyone that comes into touch with it to have a grasp of certain basic concepts. As the party to bridge the gap between different departments, FinOps is well placed to facilitate this knowledge sharing.

improvementPlan.displayText: Organize brown bags for the finance department to get to know AWS and make training available to key stakeholders. The more they understand the way AWS works, the better the cloud behavior can align with the larger organization.

choices.title: There is an established channel to share FinOps-related achievements and news.

helpfulResource.displayText: If no one hears the tree fall in the forest, did it really fall? While that is not the exact wording of that famous saying, it is very important to make the FinOps efforts in your organization known.

improvementPlan.displayText: Start by setting up an internal newsletter or monthly brownbag that can be used to share FinOps related projects going on in the company. Promote teams to bring their own pieces of content and promote good behavior. Take it as an opportunity to show what you have done and keep people on board.

choices.title: Efforts are made to build cohesion between the various stakeholders involved in FinOps.

helpfulResource.displayText: While most organizations might not have a whole team of FinOps engineers at their disposal, they do have numerous stakeholders that play a crucial role in the FinOps program. Making sure that they feel cohesion is very important to make your mission effective.

improvementPlan.displayText: Identify the key stakeholders involved in each department and organize a brainstorming session, lunch meeting, off-site or other creative space to bring their ideas and concerns together and create the atmosphere of a theme around the subject of cloud financial management.

choices.title: FinOps engineers and analysts are supported in engaging with the larger FinOps community.

helpfulResource.displayText: FinOps is a growing practice and much can be learned through the larger FinOps community. By supporting your inhouse resource to engage with that community, you help them stay on top of recent developments, which benefits your organization.

improvementPlan.displayText: Sit down with your in-house FinOps resources and discuss with them how and if they would like to participate in the larger FinOps community. This can be through meet-ups, events, community work… When there is a misalignment in desire and possibility, be sure to explain this thoroughly and look for a solution or alternative together.

choices.title: None of the above apply to us.

helpfulResource.displayText: If you don't yet have a way to nurture a FinOps culture in your entire organization, select this option.

improvementPlan.displayText: Implementing FinOps is all about breaking down the barriers between different departments. This requires a cultural exchange and maturing process with regard to the cloud. Work on implementing the other action points of this topic.
